definition: father's younger brother/uncle/Taiwan pr. [shu2 shu5]/CL:個|个[ge4]
uncle/father's younger brother/husband's younger brother/Taiwan pr. [shu2]
uncle/father's younger brother/husband's younger brother/Taiwan pr. [shu2]
queer uncle, referring to a young to middle-aged male pedophile (Internet slang)

sentences.english: You know, Uncle Brendan, I am really glad you invited me here.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，布莱登叔叔，我真的很高兴你邀请我们来。

sentences.english: It was very nice that the drivers called us "little Lei Feng"
sentences.chinese: 最让人高兴的是，司机叔叔称我们是小雷锋。

sentences.english: Aniu lived with her uncle's family.
sentences.chinese: 尔玛和她叔叔家一起生活。

sentences.english: This machine was made by Uncle Wang .
sentences.chinese: 这台机器是王叔叔造的。

sentences.english: All the way in the train the rails kept singing, "You're going to see Daddy-Long-Legs."
sentences.chinese: 一路上，铁轨都在唱着“你就要见到长腿叔叔了。”

sentences.english: Qian red looked up asked white uncle lets here?
sentences.chinese: 芊红抬头问白叔叔咱们到了吗？

sentences.english: I saw an ostrich on Uncle Yang's farm.
sentences.chinese: 我在杨叔叔的农场里看到了一只驼鸟。

sentences.english: His uncle seems to be very happy.
sentences.chinese: 他的叔叔看起开很高兴。

sentences.english: A Swatch was given to me by my uncle.
sentences.chinese: 这只斯沃琪牌的手表是叔叔给我的。

sentences.english: Uncle John immediately began applying his hand to my bare bottom and thighs .
sentences.chinese: 约翰叔叔很快开始用他的手打我的光屁股和大腿。

sentences.english: One day he saw a farmer working in the field. The farmer was working very hard under the hot sun.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他看到一位农民叔叔在炎热的天气下地干活儿。

sentences.english: Uncle Sam entertains/amuses the children for hours at a time.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆叔叔一连好几小时地逗孩子们乐。

sentences.english: My uncle opened a clothing store in Peace Street.
sentences.chinese: 我叔叔在和平街开了一家服装店。

sentences.english: The doctor put my uncle on a diet because he was over-weight.
sentences.chinese: 医生要我叔叔节食，因为他太胖了。

sentences.english: He fawns on his rich uncle.
When Uncle Satchmo sings his lullaby.
sentences.chinese: 就在路易斯叔叔唱起他的摇篮曲时。

definition: eldest brother/big brother (polite address for a man of about the same age as oneself)/gang leader/boss
older male cousin via female line
father's elder brother/term of respect for older man/CL:個|个[ge4]
younger male cousin via female line
maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
